value.0:
This surgical textbook is a step-by-step guide to methods of closing wounds.

Lavishly and gruesomely hand-illustrated it contains chapters on various types of stitching, complete with diagrams.

Other chapters cover such subjects as making needles from bone-shards and suitable types of animal sinew for use as stitching material.

More exotic methods are also covered.

'Extract from Chapter XV!'
Inventiveness is sometimes needed and the Salandran cleric should be aware af any useable sources of material in his surroundings.
For example a colony of fire-ants can be utilised to swiftly close a wound. Press the head of an ant against the edges of the wound and allow it to bite. Pinch off the body, leaving the jaws of the ant clamping the wound. Ignore the screams of the patient. He will thank you later.
